Definition: To move an object from one place to another.
To move from one place to another by moving one's feet slowly.
To move through water in a boat with oars
To take hold of something that is moving.
To make sounds expressing amusement / joy.
To move through water using ones arms and legs.
To take in information using ones eyes.
To take turns talking about a topic.
To land on the ground after being higher up (often painful).
To commit to be with someone else with the purpose of starting a family.
To see images / experience something that is not really happening (when sleeping).
Opposite of standing.  Often done on a chair but sometimes done on the floor.
To go from one place to another.
To interpret the meaning of written words.
To travel on water (boats are involved).
To travel through the air (requires wings / aircraft).
To get away from a person / place.
To move smoothly (often involves water / liquid).
To enter water from a height.
To be involved in a game.
Bird that tastes good when roasted.
Animal that can be ridden / raced.
Animal that lives in water, has fins and scales.
Living thing that is not a plant.
Animal that gives milk and goes 'moo'.
Pest that eats just about anything.
Native bird with long beak (cannot fly).
Native bird with white feathers and long graceful neck (not to be confused with swans).
Animal which can be trained to 'fetch'.
Animal with feathers and wings (can usually fly).
Animal which is cared for by humans.
Animal with four legs, a long body and very small scales.
Animals which lay leathery eggs eg: turtles, crocodiles and lizards.
Slimy garden pest which has a shell.
Furry pet which eats mice, birds and cat food.
Long animal without legs.  Often soft and squishy.
Large animal with claws and teeth.   Not native to New Zealand.
Yellow and black insect which makes honey
Animal that we use to get bacon / pork.
Animal found in rivers streams, can live both in water and on land.
Animal that makes webs to catch food.
Animal that has beautiful wings and comes out of a crysalis.
Annoying pest that often feeds on rotten food (and other gross substances).
Large mammal that lives in the ocean (not to be confused with fish).
Large bird that lives near the sea.
Long slimy fish (can be good to eat).
Covering that is worn on one's feet.
